Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322

Class MessageDateTimeFormatter

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322.MessageDateTimeFormatter
public class MessageDateTimeFormatter extends Object
RFC 5322 compliant date-time formatter for email headers. Produces dates in the canonical RFC 5322 format: - "Fri, 21 Nov 1997 09:55:06 -0600" - "Tue, 1 Jul 2003 10:52:37 +0200" (single digit day, no padding) This formatter preserves timezone information and follows RFC 5322 section 3.3 specifications exactly.
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Field Details

    • RFC5322_FORMATTER

      public static final DateTimeFormatter RFC5322_FORMATTER
      RFC 5322 compliant formatter. Format: "EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss xx" Key formatting rules per RFC 5322: - Day of week: 3-letter abbreviation (Mon, Tue, etc.) - Day of month: 1-2 digits, NO zero padding (1, 2, ..., 31) - Month: 3-letter abbreviation (Jan, Feb, etc.) - Year: 4 digits (1997, 2023, etc.) - Time: HH:mm:ss with zero padding (09:55:06) - Timezone: +/-HHMM format (RFC 5322 section 4.3)

    • RFC5322_PARSER

      public static final DateTimeFormatter RFC5322_PARSER
      Parses RFC 5322 date strings, handling both canonical format and common variations. Accepts: - "Fri, 21 Nov 1997 09:55:06 -0600" (canonical) - "21 Nov 1997 09:55:06 -0600" (without day of week) - "Fri, 05 Jul 2019 13:22:36 +0100" (zero-padded day) - "Mon, 4 Jul 2022 13:09:53 +0900" (space-padded day)

    • OBSOLETE_RFC5322_PARSER

      public static final DateTimeFormatter OBSOLETE_RFC5322_PARSER
      Obsolete date-time parser for RFC 5322 section 4.5 legacy formats. Handles legacy date-time formats that were valid in older RFCs: - Two-digit years (e.g., "99" interpreted as "1999") - Missing seconds (e.g., "21 Nov 97 09:55 -0600") - Obsolete timezone names (handled via preprocessing)

    • parseObsolete

      public static OffsetDateTime parseObsolete(String dateString)
      Parse obsolete RFC 5322 section 4.5 date-time formats. This method handles legacy date-time syntax that was valid in older RFCs but is obsolete in RFC 5322.
      Parameters:
      dateString - the obsolete date string to parse
      Returns:
      parsed OffsetDateTime, or null if parsing fails
